text: [Music]
hello I'm Sika a technical customer
service associate here at the AWS office
in Cape Town today I'm going to explain
the differences between standard and
convertible Amazon elastic Cloud compute
reserved instances let's get
started so what are reserved instances
reserved instances allow you to receive
a significant discount on your Amazon
ec2 instance usage compared with on
demand pricing there are two types of
reserved instances standard and
convertible standard reserved instances
provide you a larger discount you can
get up to 72% off on the on demand price
for a specific instance type over the
entire reservation term however they are
inflexible during the term you can't
change the instance stye AWS region
tency or other
attributes convertible reserved
instances provide a lesser discount
typically you get around 54% off on the
on demand price however convertible
reserved instances offer the flexibility
to exchange a portion or all of the
reserved instances for a different
instance
configuration this includes instance
family operating system system and tency
you can also move the reserved instance
to a different availability zone or
region so to summarize standard reserved
instances offer a higher discount but
are inflexible while convertable
reserved instances have a lower discount
but allow you to modify instance
attributes during the term when
purchasing reserved instances evaluate
your projected usage and decide whether
the flexibility of convertible reserved
instances is worth the higher cost
compared with standard reserved
instances you can view and purchase
standard and convertible reserved
instances on the ec2 console or by
running AWS CLI commands so now you know
the difference between standard and
convertible ec2 reserved
instances thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
